title: Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park: 4 Slatersville Worker Housing
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Self Guided Walking Tours     Slatersville Self Guided Tour     4 Slatersville Worker Housing                  4 Slatersville Worker Housing        Slatersville Worker house, c. 1810 NPS       Along Green Street across from the common are some of the original mill houses built by Almy, Brown, and Slater c. 1810. Originally, these were very plain, multi-family worker housing. In the 1920's they were converted into single-family management homes by Henry Kendall who added ornamental touches like side porches, fancier doorways and white picket fences as part of his efforts to restore Slatersville.       Introduction 1 Slatersville Reservoir 2 Slatersville Library and Western Mills 3 Slatersville Mills 5 Slatersville Church and Common 6 John Slater House 7 North Smithfield Town Hall 8 Slatersville Commercial Blocks
